lines.gurmukhi: skl sugMDqw imlq Argjw hoq koit Argjw imil ibsm subws kY
lines.transliteration_english: Sakal Sougandhataa Milat Aragajaa Hota , Koti Aragajaa Mili Bisam Soubaas Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: When sandalwood, musk, camphor and saffron are mixed; a fragrant paste is formed, But millions of such pastes are worthless before the fragrance of the lotus like feet of Satguru Ji.

lines.gurmukhi: skl AnUp rUp kml ibKY smwq hyrq ihrwq koit kmlw pRgws kY
lines.transliteration_english: Sakal Anoop Roop Kamal Bikhai Samaata , Hayrat Hiraat Koti Kamalaa Pragaas Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: All the beauties of the world are absorbed in Lakshmi (the consort of Vishnu) but the beautiful radiance of Lord's feet is many times more blissful and pleasant than millions of Lakshmis,

lines.gurmukhi: srb inDwn imil prm inDwn Bey koitk inDwn huie cikq iblws kY
lines.transliteration_english: Sarab Nidhaan Mili Param Nidhaan Bhaay , Kotik Nidhaan Hui Chakit Bilaas Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The wealth of the world put together becomes supreme and invaluable assets. But all the peace and comforts obtainable from many times more wealth is not even a counterpart of the comforts obtained from the spiritual bliss of the Lord,

lines.gurmukhi: crn kml gur mihmw AgwiD boiD gurisK mDukr AnBY AiBAws kY ]66]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Gur Mahimaa Agaadhi Bodhi , Gursikh Madhoukar Anabhai Abhiaas Kai ?66?

Shabad OS B.translation: The glory of the lotus feet of a True Guru is beyond the perception of a man. The devoted Sikhs enjoy and relish the elixir of the lotus feet of Fearless God through engrossing themselves in Naam Simran. (66)
